Documentation for this format

name: ExtensionConsent_Verification
title: Cross-version Extension `R5.Consent.verification` for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Consent.verification` for use in FHIR R4.
purpose:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the
element `Consent.verification` as defined in FHIR R5
in FHIR R4.

The source element is defined as:
`Consent.verification` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as:
*  R5: `Consent.verification` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4B: `Consent.verification` 0..* `BackboneElement`
*  R4: `Consent.verification` 0..* `BackboneElement`

Following are the generation technical comments:
Element `Consent.verification` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.verification`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: Consent Verified by patient or family
element.definition: Whether a treatment instruction (e.g. artificial respiration: yes or no) was verified with the patient, his/her family or another authorized person.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: An Extension

Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Has the instruction been verified.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.verification.verified` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.verification` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.verification.verified` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Consent.verification.verified`, but has no comparisons.

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Has the instruction been verified.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Extensible list of verification type starting with verification and re-validation.
element.comment: This allows the verification element to hold multiple use cases including RelatedPerson verification of the Grantee decision and periodic re-validation of the consent.
element.requirements:
Element `Consent.verification.verificationType` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Consent.verification` requires a cross-version extension.
Element `Consent.verification.verificationType` has a context of Consent.verification based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Consent`.
